HTML Production Conversion

Tasks needed to be performed * Gather all html template files, concat together * minify * convert to Javascript files * add to Angular cache

Options

  • gulp-minify-html
  • gulp-ng-html2js
  • gulp-angular-templatecache

ng-html2js converts html files into javascript and puts them in modules. This is meant to cut down on http request by not making the system call each individula html file. gulp-angular-templatecache performs the same function, with the added bonus that it will create a single module, which can then easily be added as a dependancy of our main app - in the case of the prototype that’s the main angularApp module with config routing.

Choice: gulp-angular-templatecache

This app doesn’t have built-in minification, but extensive testing proved that having GAT produce a single module worked without the bugs we ran into with nb-html2js. Minification is handled by Javascript Production Conversion because the html templates are now javascripts.
